good: V1 has excellent content structure with all requested sections
V1 typography and formatting is clean and professional
V3 contains thorough Non-negotiables (11 items) and Not in v1 (12 items) lists
bad: V2 completely lost context - created generic 'Action Required' template instead of editing V1
V2 shows placeholder instructions like 'Required Inputs' instead of actual product content
V3 is presented as instructional guidance ('Add the following sections...') not integrated into V1
Zero iteration continuity - Sidekick treated each prompt as starting fresh
Critical failure pattern: AI cannot maintain document state across prompts

prompts.title: Create Product Brief
prompts.text: Write a one-page product brief for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, key flows, MVP scope, success metrics, and risks. Use the notes on this board.
prompts.note: Created 'CareLink — Product Brief' with all 7 requested sections. Content is comprehensive and specific to the elderly care domain.

prompts.title: Tighten Content
prompts.text: Make this shorter and more decisive. Replace vague wording with clear choices.
prompts.note: CRITICAL FAILURE: Created generic 'Action Required' template instead of editing V1's content. All product brief content lost.

issues: Created template with placeholders instead of editing
Shows 'Required Inputs' and 'Style Rules' - not what was asked
All actual product content was replaced with generic instructions
Document format changed from product brief to instruction template

improvements: Should have maintained V1's content and made it more concise
Need to preserve context when iterating on documents

prompts.title: Add Sections
prompts.text: Add two sections: "Non-negotiables" and "Not in v1".
prompts.note: Created standalone document with requested sections. Content quality is good but presented as instructional guide rather than integrated into the product brief.

issues: Created requested sections but as standalone document
Header says 'Add the following sections...' - instructional rather than actual content
Does not match V1's document style - presented as guidance instead of product brief section

improvements: Should integrate new sections into existing V1 document
Should not show 'Add the following...' instructional text

good: V1 table structure is clean with proper column headers and icons

V2 destructive edit pattern - cannot add without destroying existing data
V3 regenerated all cell content with different values than V1
Unreliable iteration - data loss risk on every edit

prompts.title: Create Table
prompts.text: Create a feature table for an "Uber for elderly care" app with columns: Feature, Who it helps, Why it matters, MVP or Later.
prompts.note: Created clean 4-column table with 5 features. Color-coded tags for Who It Helps and MVP/Later.

prompts.title: Add Column
prompts.text: Add a column called "How we'll test it" and fill it in for each feature.
prompts.note: DESTRUCTIVE EDIT: Deleted 2 columns when asked to add 1. Lost 'Who It Helps' and 'MVP or Later' columns.

issues: Lost all Who It Helps and MVP/Later data from V1

improvements: Should preserve all existing columns when adding new ones
Should never delete data without explicit instruction

prompts.title: MVP Prioritization
prompts.text: Choose the smallest MVP that still works end-to-end and mark everything else as Later.
prompts.note: Successfully recovered all 5 columns with MVP/Later prioritization. Good recovery from V2's regression.

issues: Content was regenerated rather than restored from V1
MVP/Later tags use different color scheme than V1 (orange vs red/black)

good: V1 has excellent color-coded theming (blue=family needs, yellow=caregiver needs, pink=pain points, green=ideas)
V1 layout is clean with clear visual groupings (~50 stickies)

V2 lost thematic headers that organized V1

runs.summary: Sidekick created sticky notes well across all 3 prompts. V1 had 50 objects across 5 themes. V2 successfully de-duplicated and shortened to 9 objects. V3 regrouped into requested themes and flagged top priorities, though created a new artifact rather than modifying V2 in place.

issues.text: V3 created new artifact 'Regrouped Care Stickies' instead of updating 'Elderly Care Stickies' in place
V2 reduced from 50 to 9 objects - aggressive de-duplication may have lost some nuance

prompts.title: Create Stickies
prompts.text: Create sticky notes for an "Uber for elderly care" app: user needs, pain points, and product ideas. Group them into clear themes.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care Stickies' with 50 objects across 5 themes: family needs, caregiver needs, pain points for both sides, and product ideas. Color coding applied for easy scanning.

prompts.title: De-duplicate & Shorten

prompts.title: Regroup & Highlight

prompts.note: Created new artifact 'Regrouped Care Stickies' with 25 objects organized into the 5 requested themes with top priorities flagged. Did not modify existing artifact in place.

good: V1 created excellent product brief with all sections
bad: V2 replaced content with blank template
V3 created empty document

runs.summary: V1 created an excellent product brief with 6 complete sections. V2 FAILED - instead of tightening V1's content, it created a blank template with placeholders. V3 FAILED CRITICALLY - instead of adding a 'Key Differentiators' section, it created an empty 'Untitled doc'. Sidekick is not iterating on previous artifacts.

issues.text: V2 replaced V1's complete product brief with a blank template containing placeholders like '[Metric 1]', '[Capability A]'
V3 created an empty 'Untitled doc' with template picker instead of adding content to existing document
No iteration continuity - each prompt creates disconnected artifacts, losing all prior content

prompts.title: Create Product Brief
prompts.text: Write a one-page product brief for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, key flows, MVP scope, success metrics, and risks. Use the notes on this board.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care Product Brief' with 6 complete sections: Overview, Problem, Users (2 types), Key Flows (5 items), MVP Scope (IN/OUT clearly delineated), Success Metrics (5), and Risks (5). Excellent first generation.

prompts.title: Tighten Content
prompts.text: Tighten this up: cut any fluffy language, shorten each section to 1-2 crisp sentences, and keep only the 3 most important success metrics.
prompts.note: FAILED: Created blank template with placeholders instead of tightening V1's actual content. Shows generic instructions like 'State what you're building...' and placeholders like '[Metric 1]', '[Capability A]'. All V1 content lost.

prompts.title: Add Section
prompts.text: Add a "Key Differentiators" section after Problem that explains why this app beats traditional agencies. Keep the same tight style.
prompts.note: CRITICAL FAILURE: Created completely empty 'Untitled doc' showing only template picker options. No content at all. Sidekick claimed it added the section but artifact is blank.

good: V1 comprehensive flow with proper flowchart symbols (green ovals, yellow boxes, blue diamonds)
V2 perfect simplification to 7-step linear flow with clean verb-noun labels
V3 added emergency branch exactly as requested - decision diamond with Yes/No paths
V3 paths merge correctly at Confirm Booking
Excellent iteration continuity - each version builds on previous
Visual consistency maintained across all versions
runs.summary: V1 created comprehensive 23-object booking flow. V2 successfully simplified to 7-object linear flow with clean verb-noun labels. V3 correctly added parallel emergency path with decision diamond branching from Start, expedited matching path, and proper merge at Confirm Booking. All iterations built on previous versions - excellent iteration continuity.

issues.text: No significant issues detected. All prompts executed correctly with proper iteration on previous artifacts.

prompts.title: Create Booking Flow
prompts.text: Create a flowchart showing the end-to-end booking flow for an "Uber for elderly care" app: from caregiver search to booking confirmation to visit completion.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care Booking Flow' with 23 objects. Comprehensive flow showing all steps from start through search, selection, booking, payment processing, visit completion, and feedback collection. Multiple decision points and branches included.

prompts.title: Simplify Flow
prompts.text: Simplify: merge any steps that always happen together, remove edge cases, and ensure each box has a short verb-noun label.
prompts.note: Created 'Simplified Booking Flow' reducing from 23 to 7 objects. Clean linear flow: Start App -> Search Caregivers -> Select Caregiver -> Schedule Visit -> Confirm Booking -> Receive Care -> Complete Visit. All boxes have short verb-noun labels as requested.

prompts.title: Add Emergency Path
prompts.text: Add a parallel "Emergency Request" path that branches from Start and rejoins at Confirm Booking with expedited matching.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care Booking' with 11 objects. Added decision diamond 'Emergency Request?' after Start. Normal path (No) goes through Search -> Select -> Choose Time. Emergency path (Yes) goes through 'Expedited Matching' and both paths merge at Confirm Booking. Exactly as requested.

good: V1 has coherent dark purple theme with soft professional illustrations
V1 slide structure covers all requested topics
Content improved across iterations (headlines tightened, notes added)
bad: THREE completely different visual styles across three iterations
V1→V2: Changed from soft purple illustrations to bold teal/green circular graphics
V2→V3: Changed AGAIN to cream/beige with warm earthy illustrations
Zero visual consistency - looks like 3 different designers made these
Style changes were never requested - asked to tighten copy and add notes
Unusable for real presentation - would need complete redesign for consistency
runs.summary: SEVERE STYLE DRIFT: V1 (dark purple, soft illustrations) → V2 (dark with bold teal/green circular graphics) → V3 (cream/beige, warm illustrations). Three completely different visual languages. Content improved but visual execution is broken.

issues.text: V1→V2: Illustration style changed completely from soft purple to bold flat teal/green circular graphics
V2→V3: Style changed AGAIN to cream/beige backgrounds with warm earthy illustrations
Three iterations = three completely different visual identities

good: V1 created correct table structure

prompts.title: MVP Prioritization

good: V1 warm purple icon with hands cradling heart - professional and polished
V2 beautiful simplification to two hands + heart that works at small sizes
V2 maintained warm color palette (purple, peach, mauve gradient)
V3 delivered all 3 requested variations: warm outline, professional teal, high-contrast lime/navy

runs.summary: V1 created warm/friendly app icon with hands cradling heart on purple background. V2 successfully simplified to single clean symbol (two hands cupping heart) on gradient background. V3 correctly produced 3 color variations: warm outline, professional blue/teal, and high-contrast lime/navy. Perfect iteration continuity - each version built directly on the previous design.

issues.text: No significant issues detected. All prompts executed correctly with excellent iteration quality.

prompts.title: Create App Icon
prompts.text: Generate an app icon for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Style: warm, friendly, and trustworthy. Include imagery that represents care/support.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care Icon' with warm purple background, multiple hands (purple and peach) cradling a heart with coral/peach gradient. Decorative plus signs and dots add friendly feel. Matches requested warm, friendly, trustworthy style with clear care/support imagery.

prompts.title: Simplify Design
prompts.text: Make the icon simpler - reduce to a single memorable symbol that works at small sizes. Keep the warm color palette.
prompts.note: Created 'Simplified App Icon' - dramatically simplified to two hands (purple and peach) cupping a single heart on mauve/dusty rose gradient background. Clean, minimal design that works at small sizes while maintaining warm color palette. Excellent iteration on V1.

prompts.title: Color Variations
prompts.text: Show this icon in 3 color variations: the current warm palette, a professional blue palette, and a high-contrast accessible version.
prompts.note: Created 'Icon Color Variations' showing exact same simplified hands-heart symbol in 3 palettes: (1) Warm purple/coral outline on white, (2) Professional teal/blue on light gray rounded square, (3) High-contrast lime green on dark navy rounded square. All three variations requested are present with clear accessibility consideration.

good: V1 created all 6 requested features

V2 'Senior-Friendly Care' expanded to 7 screens with bigger text and clearer buttons. V3 'Edge Case Screens' covered all 5 requested scenarios but as separate artifact.

issues.text: V3 created separate 'Edge Case Screens' artifact instead of adding to existing prototype

prompts.title: Create Prototype
prompts.text: Create a mobile prototype for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Include: caregiver search, caregiver profile (verified), booking, messaging/check-ins, payment, and an emergency button. Match the vibe of the screenshots on this board.
prompts.note: Created 'Elderly Care App' with 6 screens: caregiver search with filters, verified caregiver profile with reviews, booking flow, messaging/check-ins, payment confirmation, and prominent emergency button. Matches purple app style from context.

prompts.title: Senior-Friendly
prompts.text: Make the prototype much more senior-friendly: bigger text, fewer steps, clearer primary buttons, and less clutter.
prompts.note: Created 'Senior-Friendly Care' with 7 screens. Larger text, bold primary action buttons, simplified navigation, less visual clutter. Screens include welcome, home with large icons, caregiver selection, booking confirmation, active visit tracking, payment, and help/emergency.

prompts.title: Edge Cases
prompts.text: Add the key edge-case screens: no caregivers available, caregiver late/cancels, verification pending, payment failed, emergency triggered.
prompts.note: Created 'Edge Case Screens' with 5 screens covering: No Caregivers Available (with suggestions), Caregiver Late/Cancels (with rebooking option), Verification Pending (with progress indicator), Payment Failed (with retry), Emergency Triggered (with confirmation and ETA). All requested edge cases covered.

good: V1 created complete end-to-end flow with 31 objects
V2 added all 4 edge cases with 36 objects
V3 simplified to MVP while keeping safety steps
Excellent iteration continuity
runs.summary: V1 'Care Booking Flow' created comprehensive 31-object flow from search through payment and rating. V2 correctly added edge cases (no availability, caregiver cancels, payment fails, emergency) expanding to 36 objects. V3 'MVP Care Flow' simplified to 14 objects while preserving safety-critical emergency path.

issues.text: No significant issues. All prompts executed correctly with proper iteration.

prompts.title: Create Booking Flow
prompts.text: Draw the end-to-end flow for an elderly care booking app: find caregiver -> book -> caregiver arrives -> updates during visit -> pay -> rate. Include emergencies.
prompts.note: Created 'Care Booking Flow' with 31 objects. Complete flow from Find Caregiver through Book Visit, Caregiver Arrives, Visit Updates, Payment, to Rating. Includes parallel emergency path branching from Visit Updates.

prompts.title: Add Edge Cases
prompts.text: Add the main edge cases: no availability, caregiver cancels, payment fails, emergency happens.
prompts.note: Created updated flow with 36 objects. Added decision diamonds and alternate paths for: No Caregiver Available (suggest alternatives), Caregiver Cancels (auto-rebook), Payment Fails (retry/support), Emergency Happens (escalate to authorities). All 4 edge cases integrated.

prompts.title: Simplify to MVP
prompts.text: Simplify this to the MVP flow, but keep the safety-critical steps.
prompts.note: Created 'MVP Care Flow' with 14 objects. Simplified to core path: Search -> Select -> Book -> Visit -> Pay -> Rate. Preserved safety-critical emergency branch with direct path to Emergency Services. Removed complex edge cases while maintaining essential safety functionality.

good: V1 created warm hero image matching purple style

issues.text: No issues. All prompts executed correctly with excellent iteration quality.

prompts.title: Create Hero Image
prompts.text: Create a friendly hero image for an elderly care on-demand app. It should feel safe, calm, and modern, and match the purple style on this board.
prompts.note: Created 'Hero Image Care' - warm illustration of elderly woman in coral top with gray hair sitting on couch with caregiver in blue scrubs. Tablet showing app on side table. Soft purple/lavender color palette. Safe, calm, modern atmosphere.

prompts.title: Simplify Design
prompts.text: Make it simpler and less busy, but keep the same idea.
prompts.note: Created 'Simplified Hero Image' - reduced to just two figures: elderly woman in purple dress in armchair, caregiver in purple sweater holding her hand. Removed tablet, plants, and side table. Added 'TRUST' text. Cleaner composition with more breathing room.

prompts.title: Create Variations
prompts.text: Make 3 variations: more minimal, more warm/human, and higher-contrast for accessibility.
prompts.note: Created 'Hero Image Variations' with 3 distinct styles: (1) Minimal - simple line art icons in speech bubble shape, very clean; (2) Warm/Human - photo-realistic style with real interaction feel and 'Find a Caregiver' button; (3) High-contrast - bold 'CARE ON DEMAND' with strong purple/cream contrast for accessibility. All 3 variations exactly as requested.
